conclusion: To determine the effective value of the induced electromotive force (EMF) in the coil.
Calculate the induced EMF for one turn of the coil using Faraday's law: \( \mathcal{E} = N \frac{d\Phi}{dt} \).
Determine the magnetic flux through the coil: \( \Phi(t) = B \cdot A \cdot \cos(\theta) \).
Express the area of the coil: \( A = L^2 \).
Determine the time-dependent angle \( \theta \): \( \theta(t) = \omega t \), so \( \Phi(t) = B L^2 \cos(\omega t) \).
Calculate the rate of change of magnetic flux: \( \frac{d\Phi}{dt} = -B L^2 \omega \sin(\omega t) \).
Induced EMF for one turn: \( \mathcal{E}_1(t) = -B L^2 \omega \sin(\omega t) \).
Induced EMF for \( N \) turns: \( \mathcal{E}(t) = -N B L^2 \omega \sin(\omega t) \).
Effective value of the induced EMF: \( \mathcal{E}_{\text{rms}} = \frac{\mathcal{E}_{\text{max}}}{\sqrt{2}} \), where \( \mathcal{E}_{\text{max}} = N B L^2 \omega \).
